letters.description: Creating a non-judgmental, secure environment to anchor the client's emotional vulnerability and build therapeutic trust.
Identifying and validating the specific manifestations of grief across physical, emotional, and cognitive domains.
Developing meaningful ways to honor the loss and integrate the memory or impact of the deceased into the client's current identity.
Navigating complex emotions like guilt, anger, and sorrow through guided somatic and cognitive release techniques.
Constructing new routines and a sense of purpose that acknowledges the reality of the loss while fostering a path forward.
Equipping the client with sustainable coping tools to manage future waves of grief and maintain long-term emotional stability.
